stories.text:
Solar panels, electric vehicles - we are supposed to dramatically increase production of these goods, yet for years now silver mining production is decreasing. The goal of "going green" and output of silver mining are running in opposite directions. Also artificially low silver spot price of "paper silver market" (where only small percentage of contracts is actually backed by physical silver) is not helping the situation. Low silver prices means low profitability and less producers of silver concentrate.

Yet literally no one in tech circles seems aware of that fact (if they were they would already been buying whole silver or silver/copper mines) and in industrial circles only silver miners seem to care. In general population I see this topic disputed mainly by r/wallstreetsilver crowd on reddit.

"Green politicans" obviously seem to be clueless about that basic fact. In most jurisdiction it can take well over 10 years to permit and start a new mine.

So I do not see how we are going to all switch to electric vehicles any time soon. Especially as we most likely mine not enough copper too.

What is your opinion on this strange situation?
stories.title: Decrease in production of silver is barelly disputed. We can't “go green” ATM
